page.title: 19Smarden W. - Children's Fun
page.content: Children's hobbies and pastimes include the old and the new. Board and card games are increasing in variety and now computer games are taking over in some homes. Boys are keen to own a BMX bicycle, a cycle with an extra strong frame for rough riding, jumps and twists. Girls are apt to predominate in the pony world though boys also enjoy riding and jumping. Pets abound; dogs and cats may top the list but rabbits, guinea pigs, hamsters, gerbils and goldfish are popular. Most children will collect a variety of objects: stamps, coins, shells etc., and construction toys give many happy hours in bad weather. Model railways or car racing tracks are popular, especially with fathers. Reading, painting and drawing still appeal to many and dolls still please. Ball games are as popular as ever.
